titleStmt.title: Despatch from Alberto Carlo d'Eca de Queiroz to the United States Consul, August 28, 1884

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from Alberto Carlo d'Eca de Queiroz to the United States Consul
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: I am requested by his Excellency the Governor General to acknowledge recent of your despatch of yesterday and upon the subject that it treats, he has already given the necessary orders tha a strict inquiry be made in the locality to give complete light to this affair

The natural surprise of one who finds himself suddenly expelled from a country may have given some exaggeration, in the manner of representing the facts, and upon the appreciation of the causes from which they originated, and it is not lawful to form a definite opinion until ampler proofs are furnished, by the Governor of Benguella whom His Excellency the Governor General immediately requested to send full particulars by next mail Finally, His Excellency requests me to say that he was extremely sorry to hear that the American Missionaries had been interfered wish by the Soba of Bailundo

I have &c &c &c
(Signed) Alberto Carlo d'Eca de Queiroz
Secretary to the Government
